revised_title: Magenta and Tannin's Effects on Blood Corpuscles
tldr: The author observed the effects of magenta and tannin solutions on blood corpuscles, discovering changes in their structure and appearance. When treated with magenta, blood corpuscles became transparent and expanded, revealing their nuclei and dark-red specks on their periphery. Tannin caused the formation of bright, highly refractive projections on the surface of the corpuscles, which were more pronounced in fish blood. These observations provided insights into the structure and function of blood cells.
